*** Bug 91028 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Looks like this bug was fixed at some point.  Or at least I no longer see the exceptions.  I still can't really find occurrences in external files, but I checked and Java can't either, so I guess this is working as designed.

Created an attachment (id=44917)
error message when attempt Search->Occurrences in File

If I open an HTML file via File->Open (not a file in a project, just an arbitrary HTML file) then select Source->Occurrences in File, I get a beep and a red errr message (not a dialog) in the status line which says 

  Current selection does not resolve to a searchable element

I get the same error whether I select text or not in the HTML Editor.
I no longer get exceptions. There is nothing in the Error log.

See the attachment https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=44917

I'm running with S-1.5RC5-200606161055

Is this bug really INVALID? Although the Java editor does not allow this operation, it is not even available in the menu, whereas for HTML files
it is. The operation should be disabled and not bound in the UI if it
is not supported.

My opinion is this bug was opened because exceptions were being thrown, and that has been fixed.  A new bug should be opened for the issue that Occurrences in File should be disabled for external files.
